General course objectives:
General course objectives
The primary objective of this course is to present and teach students about the function and design of electrical machines in terms of basic principles of theory of electromagnetism. Furthermore, the course focuses on means for analysis of electrical machine operation used in present and future energy system.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Magnetic circuits analysis
Three phase transformers and equivalent circuit analysis
Electromechanical energy conversion
Induction machine and equivalent circuit analysis
Experimental tests and measurements of electrical machine and use of data to identify equivalent circuit parameters
Synchronous machine and equivalent circuit and use phasor diagram analysis
DC machine and equivalent circuit of DC analysis
participate in group work and work effectively as part of a team
Content:
The topics covered in this course are:
o Magnetic Circuits
o Transformers,
o Energy conversion
o Induction Machines
o Synchronous Machines
o Direct Current (DC) machines,
